page.title: 09WINLATON TRANSPORT SURVEY
page.content: In our school survey 214 children were asked questions on their family transport habits. 93% of children owned a bicycle, but only 3O% of parents did. 7O% of families owned a car, and 15% had more than one. Very few had motor cycles. Most children walked to school each day, about 75%, but 15% came by car, and about 1O% by bus. Out of 33O parents who worked, 4O% travelled to work in their own cars, while 25% used a bus. 15% had lifts to work and 15% walked. In 1984 over 7O% of children went on holiday for at least one week. 39% had more than one holiday. 7O% of these travelled abroad, equal proportions by sea and air. Children taking holidays in the U.K. mainly travelled by car. ( WINLATON WEST LANE PRIMARY SCHOOL ).
